page.title: 19Movement in the area 2
page.content: 4 mills have been turned into houses and many farms cater for tourists or are mere hobbies not subsistence farming. There are many old cob cottages which have been modernised, making very fashionable dwellings. A look at the baptism and burial registers shows that people are living longer and in this area fewer young families are finding it expedient to stay. Expensive housing, a village school several miles distant, shopping a good journey away either in New Milton or Lymington prove powerful deterrents to young married couples. The baptism register 1839-1841 records the occupations of the fathers as follows- 1 blacksmith, 1 shoemaker, 43 labourers,1 gipsy, 1 painter and 1 dairyman.
